result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian Omar Hernandez-Serrano

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. JM

Defendant Christian Omar Hernandez-Serrano not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Bench warrant issued on 12/22/2015 to be continued. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Paul A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failed to appear.  Court ordered a BENCH WARRANT issued REMAND to COMMISSIONER.  Court ordered any bail on deposit forfeited.  Jury Trial date is vacated.

JusticePoint DISCHARGE SUMMARY received and filed.
Court will address on next court date.
JusticePoint Violation Report (new arrest) received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated October 21, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Christian Omar Hernandez-Serrano in court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.
Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 38.  Parties are advised by the Court that any motions are to be filed with the court no later than 11-23-2015.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.M.Z-B. DOB 04/10/89 and her child, Y.H., J.Z. DOB 05/18/55.

Defendant Christian Omar Hernandez-Serrano in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Christian Omar Hernandez-Serrano in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. LM  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
